ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It is a course requiring serious reading, thinking and discussion. I will highly recommend this course, for it is indeed helpful and inspiring.

I would totally recommend, and I will recommend Comparative Literature 515 01 to another student. I would describe the course as a formative experience which instructs you in the bases of Comparative Literature. It is a course that changes the way you understand literature, and gives you the vocabulary to talk about Comparative literature intellegently. All in all a great class
I would recommend it to any fervent devotee of theory.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course has not only deepened my understanding of certain theories but the more importantly, has adjusted my way of reading, thinking and narration. Interactions with Prof. Saussy and classmates have broadened both of my knowledge and intellectual vision.

this course allowed me to deepen my knowledge of what it means to be a literary critic and provided me with the intellectual tools to engage different literary traditions than my own (italian or english). It was very useful and it will be very useful for my carrier as a literary scholar.
The course gave me good foundations in theory and made me aware of the critical issues revolving around comparative literature.
